TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BatteryManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The BatteryManager class contains strings and constants used for values in the Intent, and provides a method for querying battery and charging properties.

remarks.para: The BatteryManager class contains strings and constants used for values in the Intent, and provides a method for querying battery and charging properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.BatteryProperty BatteryPropertyCurrentAverage = (3)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.OS.BatteryProperty enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Average battery current in microamperes, as an integer.

remarks.para: Average battery current in microamperes, as an integer. Positive values indicate net current entering the battery from a charge source, negative values indicate net current discharging from the battery. The time period over which the average is computed may depend on the fuel gauge hardware and its configuration.

remarks.para: Instantaneous battery current in microamperes, as an integer. Positive values indicate net current entering the battery from a charge source, negative values indicate net current discharging from the battery.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetIntProperty(int32 id) cil managed

Docs.summary: Return the value of a battery property of integer type.

remarks.para: Return the value of a battery property of integer type. If the platform does not provide the property queried, this value will be Integer.MIN_VALUE.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 GetLongProperty(int32 id) cil managed

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
